author: Staff Reporter
text:
Neyveli Lignite Corporation (NLC) in association with Neyveli Ladies Club organised an entrepreneurship development programme for women from the peripheral villages to enable them sustain their livelihood.

Inaugurating the training programme, Yogamaya Acharya, president of Neyveli Ladies Club said that NLC had been carrying out development works in the surrounding villages right from its inception.

During 2014-15, as many as 165 women from various villages were trained in Light Motor Vehicle driving, tailoring and beautician trades. The programme is a platform for women to learn skills and more number of women from the surrounding villages should participate, Mrs. Acharya said. She also gave away Driving License documents to 50 women who were trained in the Light Motor Vehicle driving.

Devaki Thanga Pandian, vice-president, Neyveli Ladies Club, exhorted women from the peripheral villages to make full use of the training and improve their livelihood. Employees of Corporate Social Responsibility department and members of Ladies club participated.
title: Entrepreneurship development programme for women
